intro: Jeffersonia dubia, commonly known as the Jeffersonia, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family, which includes buttercups and lilies, and is characterized by its delicate, palmate leaves. The plant produces showy, white or pale yellow flowers with five petals, typically blooming in early spring. Jeffersonia dubia thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it a valuable component of native plant ecosystems.
